data.title: Philip Rivers – Bio, Kids, Wife, Family Life, Career Stats and Net Worth
data.meta_description: When it comes to making and breaking American football touchdown records, the Los Angeles Chargers' Philip Rivers are among those to be named. The
data.text:
He was named Most Valuable Player (MVP) in 2000 when he led his team to a win against Minnesota. Philip won 8 straight Rookie of the Week Awards and was named All-American and MVP in another game at the Tangerine Bowl. In this game, his team lost.

He played 51 total games and recorded 13,484 passes, 1,147 passes with 95 touchdowns in his collegiate career. He was ranked North Carolina’s 8th All-Time Highest.

career statistics

In Philip River’s rookie year, he only played in 2 games and only 1 touchdown, 5 passes for 33-yard passes, 1 forced fumble but no interception. He received a passer rating of 110.9% that season. He kept it up as passes and touchdowns increased, peaking in 2008 with 312 completed passes for 4,009 yards, 11 interceptions, 34 pass touchdowns and 6 total forced fumbles.

Additionally, as the seasons progressed, PhilipRivers relentlessly tracked his points, receiving 437 finishing passes for the 2015 season on 4,792 yard passes, 13 interceptions, 661 passes attempted, and 29 touchdown passes with a 93% QB rating for the season.

Philip Rivers celebrated his 15th season in 2018. Since his appointment in August 2004, he signed a $40.5 million, six-year contract with the Chargers that included $14.5 million in bonuses. He is one of the oldest and most experienced quarterbacks and arguably one of the most nominated and honored NFL players of all time. He’s already blowing red hot at the start of the 2018 season as he has 8 touchdowns, 75 completed passes for 906-yard rushes and 1 interception.

Philip Rivers has paid his debts over the years as a quarterback and has also been duly recognized and recognized for his contributions to the NFL. One of the notable records he broke was in 2009 when he collected the 83.3% completion pass against the Cowboys. Other recognitions include Pro Bowl selections in 2006, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2013, 2016 and 2017, NFL Passport in 2010 and 2015, and 4x AFC Offensive Player of the Month in 2008, 2009 , December, October 2010 and 2009 September 2014 as well as the NFL Comeback Player of the Year (AP, PFWA – 2013).

Family Life – His wife and children

Steve and Joan Rivers are Philip Rivers’ parents. Philip Rivers has two siblings, Stephen and Anna. His father was a school principal who inspired his career while his mother was a teacher. Philip’s father was a one-time linebacker and played for Mississippi State in the 1970s, while his brother Stephen also played for Austin High School, Louisiana State University, Northwestern State University and briefly for Vanderbilt University from 2014-2015.

Rivers is married to his longtime high school friend Tiffany. They were married in 2001 and reside in San Diego County, California. They have quite a large family with 8 children, 6 girls – Halle, Grace, Caroline, Rebecca, Sarah, Claire and 2 boys – Gunner and Peter Philip.

Despite being a high-earning professional soccer player, Philip lives a very humble lifestyle. Mostly dressed in modest casual wear and cowboy boots, he drives a 2008 Ford. He recently spent an estimated $200,000 acquiring a custom SUV that served as his commuter between San Diego County, where he and his family lived at his new LA location lived. The footballer decided against moving his family to the new location, preferring to drive the customized SUV for 6 to 7 hours a day.

From 2010 to 2012, Philip and Tiffany started Riversund funded the Rivers Hope Foundation, a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting foster children. A notable beneficiary of this program is the San Pascal Academy Formation Home for Foster Youth.

His capital

Philip Rivers earns an estimated $20.8 million annually. A rough estimate shows the quarterback has earned almost $180 million since he started with the Chargers. His net worth is set at $80 million.
